response.answer_text: Even complicated subjects (such as organic chemistry) might look easy on the “lower” tiers. It is included in some courses, as a prerequisite for other subjects, and you would often see it being refered to as “basic organic chemistry” or “organic chemistry for the life sciences”, sometimes mockingly so. In the time span of 3–6 months, one can only begin to scratch the surface of it all, and some portions of the material will seem easier than others, but only people that have received the full package (like, organic chemists, or biochemists) can testify to whether (and to what extent) organic chemistry is “easy”.

Chemistry is a very easy subject , specially organic chemistry is the beat part of chemistry , it will become very easy to learn organic chem. if you start imagining the molecules , from where attacking reagents attacked , forming products too become easy once u are able to imagine the mechanism . even if u are not able to do so just ask me again for help , i love organic chem and i will love to make someone understand it.
